light_detection.notes: Some species within this family are photosynthetic and rely on symbiotic zooxanthellae. Therefore, they must be able to detect light levels to ensure sufficient photosynthesis. This indicates a basic light detection capability.

water_flow_detection.notes: As sessile filter-feeders, Axinellidae likely possess the ability to detect water flow to optimize filter feeding. This is a common trait in sponges.

chemical_detection.notes: Sponges rely on chemoreception to detect food particles and avoid harmful substances in the water.
